alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued December 02 at 11:28AM MST until December 02 at 12:45PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A DUST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM MST FOR YUMA COUNTY... At 1125 AM MST, a wall of dust was along a cold front extending from 4 miles northwest of Highland Center to 4 miles south of Platner to 6 miles west of Elba to 5 miles west of Last Chance, moving southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Less than a mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 60 mph. The Akron airport measured a 68 mph wind gust as the cold front moved over area. SOURCE...Doppler radar and satellite observations. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Wray, Bonny Reservoir, Eckley, Abarr, Beecher Island and Wauneta. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust can be unhealthy and has been known to lead to Valley Fever. Avoid outdoor exposure. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
